intro: Uapaca nitida var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved velvetball, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers followed by spherical, fuzzy fruits that are edible. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and riverine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
